meanings.definition: (verb) to fire a weapon along the length of a target
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were enfilading the enemy's position with precise rifle fire.
meanings.sent2: The archers enfiladed the advancing army, causing chaos among the ranks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels enfiladed the bird feeder, stealing all the seeds for themselves.
meanings.sent4: Her piercing gaze enfiladed through the crowd, searching for her lost cat.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays enfiladed through the trees, creating a beautiful pattern on the forest floor.

meanings.definition: (adjective) positioned so as to be able to fire along the length of a target
meanings.sent1: The enfilading cannons were strategically placed on the hill to cover the entire battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The sniper found an enfilading position on the rooftop, overlooking the street below.
meanings.sent3: The cat found an enfilading spot on the bookshelf to observe the room without being noticed.
meanings.sent4: The detective took an enfilading approach to the case, gathering evidence from multiple angles.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed in an enfilading path through the valley, reflecting the colors of the sunset.
